lesson.title_and_level: Upper-Intermediate - The Scene of the Accident

sentence.idiomatic: There are a lot of people on that street, we'd best drive more slowly.
Economists are currently discussing the reasons behind the slowing economic development these few years.
You clearly saw someone wanting to cross the road ahead, why didn't you reduce your speed, but speed up instead?
As soon as I got anxious, I turned on the wrong turn signal.
He often forgets to turn on his turn signal when turning corners.
Why are you turning on your left turn signal when turning right?
The driver slammed on the brakes at once, causing a lot of passengers to slam into the back of the seat in front of them.
It was really dangerous, when I was descending the hill the brakes on my bike failed.
A big truck charged out into the intersection, and simply didn't have the time to hit the brakes.
I've heard he was hit by a truck, but I don't know if he was hurt badly.
He knocked down an old lady, and I took her to the hospital with him.
He was driving and talking on the phone at the same time, and the result was that he couldn't hit the brakes in time and slammed into the taxi that had stopped ahead.
I told him clearly that I like roses, but he sent me lilies.

word.literal: to be or not to be

sentence.idiomatic: She is clearly at home, but she doesn't answer the phone. Is she angry?
You clearly know the answer, why don't you tell me?

word.literal: to run through a red light

sentence.idiomatic: He was given a ticket by a traffic cop for running a red light.

word.literal: to run through a red light

sentence.idiomatic: I'm sorry, I ran the red light accidentaly. I only did it because I've got something pressing.

word.literal: to run through a red light

sentence.idiomatic: For your own and other people's safety, please obey traffic regulations, and don't run red lights.
He was brought to the police station for driving drunk in contravention of traffic regulations.
She is very honest; she probably wouldn't do anything that broke the law.
He cooperated with another company at the same time he cooperated with us, in contravention of our contract.
She always blames her brother for her mistakes.
Every time he fails a test he blames it on bad luck, it's really laughable.
This is your height--you can't grow any taller, and it's no use blaming your parents.
After the soccer match was over, he finally understood that how poor his skills were.
She didn't know that file was useful, and so deleted it. Please don't blame her.
I'm not her, how can I know what's in her head?
The two strongest teams played together. This sort of clash of titans is certainly very interesting.

word.literal: to avoid; to slip free of

sentence.idiomatic: To clash with competitors is not a good idea. You should find a way out.
You are weak and if you clash with him mano-a-mano, you'll certainly lose.

word.literal: to get out of the car
to cry and cause a commotion
to be hurt as a result of being hit
to run through a red light
to cry and cause a commotion
the person together with the vehicle
to be very clear about something
to pass a vehicle; to overtake
